results_summary: The keratin-based nanofibers demonstrated good biocompatibility (except sumac-based), structural similarity to human extracellular matrix, and high cell migration rates (89% and 85% for acorn and curcumin nanofibers, respectively), indicating potential for advanced wound care.
population_specificity: In vitro murine fibroblast cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the prognostic significance of the Keratin (KRT) family gene in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and develop a KRT gene signature (KGS) for predicting clinical outcomes and guiding therapy.
results_summary: High expression of the KGS signature was strongly associated with poorer overall survival in LUAD patients and correlated with aggressive tumor progression, including activation of TGF-β and WNT-β catenin signaling pathways, epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT), and increased tumor stemness. KGS-high tumors also showed heightened sensitivity to targeted therapies like gefitinib, erlotinib, lapatinib, and trametinib.
population_specificity: Patients with lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) from TCGA and GEO databases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the roles of KRT7 in cancer progression and metastasis and assess its potential as a therapeutic target.
results_summary: KRT7 overexpression is linked to tumor progression and metastasis in various cancers, and its suppression leads to rapid tumor regression, suggesting its potential as a therapeutic target. The study also highlights KRT7's prognostic significance in cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Human cancers (no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of KeraStat® Cream (KC) in managing radiation dermatitis symptoms in breast cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.
results_summary: KC was safe and well-tolerated with no adverse events. It showed trends of reduced radiation dermatitis severity and improved quality of life compared to standard care, though the study was not powered for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.
study_duration: From day 1 of radiotherapy through 30 days post-radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the ability of human hair keratin dimer to absorb diclofenac and perfluorobutanesulfonate as a potential sustainable filtration material.
results_summary: The study found that human hair keratin dimer has high binding affinities for diclofenac and perfluorobutanesulfonate, suggesting its potential as an effective filtration material. Molecular dynamics simulations supported these findings, motivating further research.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in silico study)
study_duration: Molecular dynamics simulations conducted for over 1 μs

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and map the clinical evidence of the prognostic and predictive value of cytokeratin 17 (K17) in human cancers.
results_summary: K17 was found to be a negative prognostic factor in the majority of studied cancer types, including HPV-associated cancers like HNSCC and cervical cancer, and a positive prognostic factor in a few cancer types. It also showed negative predictive value for chemotherapy and immune checkpoint blockade therapy response in most predictive studies.
population_specificity: Patients with various cancer types, particularly head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC), triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC), and pancreatic cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of human keratin matrix (HKM) as a novel biomaterial for treating chronic wounds by assessing its in vitro and in vivo performance.
results_summary: HKM demonstrated degradation resistance and high keratin purity (>99%). It enhanced keratinocyte activation markers and cytokine release, and in a murine chronic wound model, HKM-treated wounds healed faster and were smaller compared to other treatments (AM, BD, SIS).
population_specificity: Adult human epidermal keratinocytes (HEKa), adult human dermal fibroblasts (HDFa), and a murine chronic wound model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic potential of WB518, a novel small molecule compound, for treating psoriasis by targeting abnormal keratinocyte proliferation, differentiation, and inflammatory response.
results_summary: WB518 significantly reduced Keratin 17 (K17) levels by inhibiting STAT3 phosphorylation, improved scaling and inflammation in psoriasis mouse models, and suppressed inflammatory cytokines like IL-1β, IL-6, IL-17, and IL-23.
population_specificity: HaCaT cells (in vitro) and IMQ/TPA-induced psoriasis mouse models (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of keratin 23 (KRT23) on the anticancer activity of melatonin (MLT) against gastric cancer (GC) cells.
results_summary: KRT23 knockout reduced phosphorylation of ERK1/2 and p38, arrested the cell cycle, and inhibited GC cell proliferation, enhancing MLT's antitumor effects by suppressing p38/ERK phosphorylation. KRT23 was significantly upregulated in GC cells compared to normal cells and downregulated by MLT treatment.
population_specificity: Gastric cancer cell lines (AGS and SNU-216) and normal gastric epithelial cell line (GES-1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CSF1 is overexpressed in XGET/KPGCT tumors and if the CSF1/CSF1R pathway plays a role in their pathogenesis.
results_summary: The study found that all 6 cases of XGET/KPGCT showed increased CSF1 expression via qPCR and were positive for CSF1 CISH, supporting the involvement of the CSF1/CSF1R pathway in these tumors. The findings suggest potential therapeutic implications for CSF1R inhibition in unresectable or metastatic cases.
population_specificity: Cases of XGET/KPGCT tumors (6 cases studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a bilayer wound dressing containing keratin (Kr), honey (Hny), and vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) in accelerating wound healing.
results_summary: The bilayer dressing promoted faster wound healing, angiogenesis, collagen synthesis, and epidermal layer generation compared to other groups, with demonstrated cytocompatibility and cell migration support.
population_specificity: In vivo animal model (full-thickness wounds) and human keratinocyte cells in vitro.
study_duration: VEGF release was monitored over 7 days; wound healing duration not explicitly stated.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel method for identifying keratinase activity to repurpose keratin from sheep wool for textile and industrial biotechnology applications.
results_summary: The study described a colorimetric method using α-keratin azure (KA) to monitor keratinase activity, optimized substrate pre-treatment and reaction conditions, and investigated the reduction of keratin disulfide bonds for improved degradation. Milling and washing of the KA substrate improved reproducibility, and centrifugation effectively removed unreacted material.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether keratinocyte-derived signals, particularly involving Keratin 17 (K17), mediate neutrophil recruitment in inflamed skin under stress conditions.
results_summary: The study found that K17-dependent sustainment of PKCα activity and release of neutrophil chemoattractants by stressed keratinocytes amplifies neutrophil recruitment in inflamed skin, with implications for chronic inflammatory skin diseases.
population_specificity: Mouse model (sterile inflammation induced by TPA and UVB).
effective_dosage: Not specified (single and repeated TPA treatments, UVB challenge).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the synergistic effect of K31-PGLa photopolymerized hydrogels with commercial antibiotics against drug-resistant bacteria and their potential for infectious wound healing.
results_summary: K31-PGLa demonstrated a synergistic effect with antibiotics by down-regulating efflux pump synthesis genes, suppressed drug-resistant bacteria growth, and enhanced wound closure in murine models.
population_specificity: Murine (mice) models

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and optimize keratin nanoparticles for improved antifungal drug delivery, focusing on size, polydispersity, and encapsulation efficiency.
results_summary: Keratin nanoparticles showed high encapsulation efficiency (91 ± 1.9%), sustained drug release, acceptable biocompatibility, and significant inhibitory effects against Microsporum canis compared to free tioconazole.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Different amounts of tioconazole were loaded, but exact dosages were not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether MEK inhibition promotes keratinocyte differentiation, potentially reducing squamous cell carcinoma incidence under BRAFi/MEKi combination therapy.
results_summary: MEK inhibition significantly increased the expression of differentiation-associated keratins K10 and K1 in human immortalized keratinocytes, suggesting it may reduce squamous cell carcinoma incidence by promoting keratinocyte differentiation.
population_specificity: Human immortalized keratinocytes (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Different concentrations of MEKi (specific amounts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to demonstrate the reutilization of industrial chicken feather waste (keratin) into proton-conductive membranes for renewable energy applications.
results_summary: Keratin was isolated from chicken feathers, converted into amyloid fibrils, and processed into membranes with proton conductivity (6.3 mS cm-1). These membranes were successfully used in fuel cells (25 mW cm-2 power density), water-splitting devices, and protonic transistors.
population_specificity: Industrial waste (chicken feathers)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effect of KRT15 knockdown on liver cancer malignant behaviors and its interaction with the β-catenin pathway.
results_summary: KRT15 knockdown reduced cell viability and invasion, promoted apoptosis, and enhanced doxorubicin chemosensitivity in liver cancer cells by inactivating the β-catenin pathway.
population_specificity: Liver cancer cell lines (Huh7, PLC, Hep3B, HepG2) compared to normal liver cell line THLE-2.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of three hair treatments in reducing drug concentrations in keratin (hair) for forensic drug testing purposes.
results_summary: Treatment 1 (baking soda, salicylic acid, bleach) was most effective, significantly lowering drug concentrations (up to 90% for cocaine) without noticeable damage to the keratin matrix, making detection difficult. Methadone and THC were less affected compared to other drugs like cocaine and MAM.
population_specificity: Hair samples (not specified if human or synthetic).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the dynamics of Keratin 19 (KRT19) expression in pancreatic ductal lineage and its role in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) development.
results_summary: The study found that KRT19 expression shifts from biallelic to monoallelic during ductal maturation, with oncogenic KRASG12D signaling reversing this switch. High KRT19 levels correlated with low DNA methylation, decreased survival in PDAC patients, and potential use as a biomarker for treatment stratification.
population_specificity: Human pluripotent stem cells (PSCs), pancreatic duct-like organoids, and human PDAC cohorts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify compounds that could normalize mutation-triggered keratin filament disruption and evaluate their therapeutic potential for keratin-associated diseases.
results_summary: Parthenolide reversed keratin filament disruption, protected cells and mice from apoptosis, normalized keratin acetylation, and upregulated SIRT2. It also showed protective effects in human K18 variants and keratinocytes with K14-R125C mutations.
population_specificity: Cells and mice expressing keratin mutations (K18-R90C, K14-R125C) and human K18 variants associated with liver injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a peptide-drug conjugate (18-4-Dox) targeting Keratin 1 (K1) could selectively deliver chemotherapy to triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) tumors while sparing healthy tissues.
results_summary: The study found that the 18-4-Dox conjugate significantly reduced tumor volume in mice, increased apoptosis, and lowered proliferation markers compared to free Dox. It also showed preferential uptake by TNBC tumors via K1 receptor mediation, with reduced toxicity to normal tissues.
population_specificity: Mice bearing orthotopic MDA-MB-231 tumors (a model for triple-negative breast cancer).
effective_dosage: 2.5 mg/kg of Dox equivalent, administered weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a keratin-based hydrogel dressing and investigate its effectiveness, particularly when combined with LL-37 antimicrobial peptide, in treating full-thickness wounds in rats.
results_summary: The LL-37-containing keratin hydrogel (L-KO25:KN75) significantly improved wound healing, with >98% wound closure by day 21, enhanced fibroblast proliferation, adhesion, and migration, and demonstrated strong antibacterial effects against both Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. Angiogenesis and mRNA expression of VEGF and IL-6 were also notably increased.
population_specificity: Full-thickness rat wounds.
effective_dosage: 10% (w/v) hydrogels with different ratios of keratose and kerateine (25:75% for L-KO25:KN75).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high expression of keratin 17 (CK17) predicts resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) therapy in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) patients.
results_summary: High CK17 expression was associated with lack of disease control, shorter time to treatment failure, and progression-free survival in HNSCC patients treated with pembrolizumab. CK17 RNA expression also predicted outcomes in a broader cohort of pembrolizumab-treated cancer patients.
population_specificity: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) patients treated with pembrolizumab, with validation in a broader cohort of cancer patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the performance characteristics of different K5 antibody clones (D5/16 B4, XM26, SP27, EP1601Y) in distinguishing between lung cancer subtypes, particularly adenocarcinomas and squamous cell carcinomas.
results_summary: Clone SP27 showed higher analytical sensitivity but lower clinical specificity due to positive reactions in 25% of adenocarcinomas, while D5/16 B4 exhibited nonspecific staining. The other clones (EP1601Y, XM26) demonstrated equal sensitivity without the drawbacks of SP27 or D5/16 B4.
population_specificity: Lung cancer specimens (31 SCCs, 59 ACs, 17 large cell carcinomas, 8 large cell neuroendocrine carcinomas, 5 carcinosarcomas, 10 small cell carcinomas).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to chemically modify keratin to create Schiff bases for heavy metal ion adsorption.
results_summary: The modified keratin showed promising results in adsorbing copper and lead ions, achieving about 40% removal from aqueous solutions at pH 6.5-7. The study confirmed the synthesis of Schiff bases using FTIR and DSC spectra.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a repair solution containing hydrolysed wool keratin, serine, and transglutaminase could effectively repair damaged hair and protect healthy hair.
results_summary: The repair solution improved physical and chemical properties of damaged hair, reducing alkali solubility by 50.53%, increasing fracture stress and strain, enhancing thermal stability, and maintaining effects after multiple washes. It also protected healthy hair from chemical damage and outperformed general hair care products.
population_specificity: Damaged and healthy hair samples (in vitro study).
study_duration: Effects were measured after five washing cycles (duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the molecular structure of chicken feather keratin 1 and assess the effects of magnetic field treatment on its functional and surface structural properties.
results_summary: The study predicted the IR spectrum of keratin and confirmed changes in particle size (reduction to 23.71 ± 1.1 nm) and molecular element displacement following magnetic field treatment. Experimental molecular weights differed from predicted values.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on keratin extracted from chicken feathers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the roles of estrogen and keratin 17 (K17) in MmuPV1 infection and associated disease progression in the female reproductive tract.
results_summary: K17 knockout mice showed a higher percentage of viral clearance compared to wild-type mice, while estrogen treatment increased viral copy numbers and prevented clearance in both groups. K17 and estrogen exacerbated neoplastic disease progression and modulated the immune microenvironment.
population_specificity: Female laboratory mice (wild-type and K17 knockout) infected with MmuPV1.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biocompatibility and therapeutic efficacy of a keratin-wrapped Cu-MOFs drug delivery system for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The keratin shell reduced cytotoxicity and leakage of Cu-MOFs to normal cells, enhanced tumor accumulation via the EPR effect, and enabled controlled drug release. Additionally, Cu-MOFs produced hydroxyl radicals, decreasing tumor cell viability.
population_specificity: Tumor cells (in vitro and in vivo models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether keratin 6a-derived antimicrobial peptides (KAMPs) could simultaneously address bacterial infection and inflammation, particularly in corneal infections.
results_summary: KAMPs suppressed NFκB and IRF3 activation, reduced proinflammatory cytokine production, and decreased phagocyte recruitment, while also competing with bacterial ligands for TLR receptors. Topical KAMP treatment significantly reduced corneal opacification, inflammatory cell infiltration, and bacterial burden in experimental bacterial keratitis.
population_specificity: Murine peritoneal neutrophils, macrophages, and an in vivo model of sterile corneal inflammation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the interaction between permethrin and keratin, and how keratin affects permethrin's cutaneous bioavailability in hyperkeratotic skin.
results_summary: The study found that keratin particles interact with permethrin, reducing its cutaneous bioavailability, and demonstrated a "steal effect" where keratin-adherent permethrin was less available for penetration into the stratum corneum.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro model using keratin particles and Franz diffusion cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report clinical data on four WSN patients from the same family with a K4 gene mutation and discuss the disease's etiology, diagnosis, and treatment.
results_summary: The study identified a heterozygous deletion in the K4 gene in the proband and his father, leading to an aspartic acid loss, and reported the first occurrence of WSN in monozygotic twins with similar clinical presentations.
population_specificity: Four WSN patients from the same family, including a pair of monozygotic twins.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a method for keratin regeneration from chicken feathers using ultrasound and Cysteine-reduction, focusing on improving solubility and yield without damaging keratin's properties.
results_summary: The study found that ultrasound significantly improved feather degradation and keratin solubility, with optimal conditions (130 W, 2.7 h, 15% Cys) yielding high solubility without structural or thermal stability damage. Prolonged ultrasonic time (>4 h) reduced keratin yield and thermal stability, while increased power enhanced solubility without adverse effects.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using chicken feathers)
effective_dosage: 15% Cysteine-reduction, 130 W ultrasonic power, 2.7 h treatment time

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of innovative keratin-based carriers encapsulating terbinafine for treating onychomycosis, focusing on controlled release and antifungal activity.
results_summary: Keratin-PEG-modified carriers showed enhanced terbinafine release and a 2-fold larger inhibition halo against Trichophyton rubrum compared to pure keratin carriers. No antifungal activity was observed in keratin-based particles without terbinafine.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study using mimetic biologic solutions and Trichophyton rubrum).
effective_dosage: Not specified (textiles functionalized with 100% keratin or 80% keratin/20% keratin-PEG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of topical estrogen cream as a noninvasive treatment for clitoral keratin pearls in pediatric patients.
results_summary: The study found that topical estrogen cream resolved symptoms in two prepubertal girls with clitoral adhesions and keratin pearls, suggesting it as a viable initial treatment option. The results indicate that hypoestrogenism may contribute to adhesion formation, supporting the use of estrogen therapy.
population_specificity: Prepubertal girls with chronic clitoral irritation and keratin pearls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the hypoglycemic effect of primaquine by targeting Keratin 7 (K7) and explore its role in activating the EGFR/Akt glucose metabolism signaling pathway to improve T2DM complications.
results_summary: Primaquine, by targeting K7, activated the EGFR/Akt pathway, enhancing aerobic glycolysis and improving glucose metabolism. It also ameliorated kidney function and restored plasma LDL-C levels, reducing diabetic complications.
population_specificity: C57BL/6N mice with induced T2DM and HepG2 cells in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective coating efficiency of keratin/alginate hydrogels filled with halloysite nanotubes (HNTs) on human hair exposed to UV irradiation.
results_summary: The study found that keratin/alginate/HNT hydrogels improved the tensile properties of human hair after UV exposure, suggesting effective protection. The hydrogel's structural and rheological properties were enhanced by the interactions between keratin, alginate, and HNTs.
population_specificity: Human hair samples (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether modifying chicken feather keratin with graphene oxide improves its sorption capacity for removing multiple trace metal ions from contaminated water.
results_summary: The modified keratin/graphene oxide biosorbents effectively removed up to 99% of various metal ions (including arsenic, selenium, chromium, nickel, cobalt, lead, cadmium, and zinc) from synthetic polluted water within 24 hours, primarily through electrostatic interaction, chelation, and complexation.
population_specificity: Synthetic polluted water (not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (study used 600 μgL-1 of each metal concentration in water).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of keratin-coated gold nanoparticles (Ker-AuNPs) in 3D bioprinted glioblastoma models for photo-thermal therapy applications.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that Ker-AuNPs were uniformly distributed within 3D bioprinted glioblastoma cells and effectively generated heat (16 °C rise in under 2 minutes) under laser irradiation, indicating strong potential for photo-thermal therapy.
population_specificity: Glioblastoma U87-MG cells in a 3D bioprinted model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether RGDSP culture promotes keratin-7 (K7) expression in human salivary gland stem/progenitor cells (hS/PCs) and identify factors governing this expression.
results_summary: The study found that RGDSP cultures significantly increased K7 expression in hS/PCs, linked to elevated TGF-β1 signaling. Inhibition of TGF-β signaling with A83-01 repressed K7 expression while maintaining the cells' regenerative potential.
population_specificity: Primary human salivary gland stem/progenitor cells (hS/PCs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between common keratin 6 variants and the severity of atopic dermatitis over time, using a Bayesian generalized linear mixed model to account for repeated measures.
results_summary: The study identified groups of keratin 6 variants with similar effects on skin repair, suggesting a potential role in atopic dermatitis severity. Further exploration of these biological mechanisms may inform future treatments.
population_specificity: Individuals with atopic dermatitis (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Keratin 8 (K8) impacts the trafficking of misfolded proteins like Z-A1AT and F508del-CFTR and to elucidate the mechanism underlying K8-dependent regulation of protein trafficking via the ERAD pathway.
results_summary: Diminishing K8 concentration enhanced secretion of Z-A1AT and WT-A1AT, with a 13-fold and fourfold increase, respectively. K8 was found to act as an ERAD modulator, scaffolding early-stage ERAD complexes and regulating Hrd1-governed processes, with its inhibition increasing Z-A1AT secretion.
population_specificity: HeLa cells and respiratory cells from Z-homozygous A1ATD patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of Keratin 8 (KRT8) in pancreatitis and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), including its potential as a diagnostic and prognostic marker.
results_summary: KRT8 was upregulated in pancreatitis and PDAC tissues, negatively impacting PDAC prognosis. Knockdown of KRT8 impaired migration, proliferation, and induced apoptosis in PDAC cell lines, suggesting its role in cancer progression.
population_specificity: Murine pancreatitis model, human chronic pancreatitis (CP) tissue, human PDAC tissue, and PDAC cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the heat-protecting effect of a keratin-based product on human hair fibers, both ex vivo and in vivo.
results_summary: The study found that the product preserved keratin structure after thermal stress, reduced surface damage (e.g., fewer "bubbles" and "crackling"), and promoted the α-helix keratin conformation while protecting disulfide bonds. In vivo tests confirmed these protective effects and positive consumer perception.
population_specificity: Human hair samples from 5 donors (in vivo) and ex vivo hair fibers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether keratin, as a thiol donor food source, could enhance endogenous antioxidants in endurance athletes without blunting training adaptations.
results_summary: The abstract suggests keratin may enhance endogenous antioxidants, potentially improving performance and recovery for endurance athletes, but does not provide specific results or data on its effects.
population_specificity: Endurance athletes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maternal probiotics could prevent atopic dermatitis in children with and without filaggrin gene (FLG) mutations, which disrupt the skin keratin layer.
results_summary: The study found that maternal probiotics reduced the risk of atopic dermatitis (RR = 0.6) regardless of FLG mutation status, with similar effects in children with mutations (RR = 0.6) and those without (RR = 0.6). The preventive effect was evident in children without FLG mutations, but larger confirmatory studies are needed.
population_specificity: Children (n = 228) from the ProPACT study, including those with and without FLG mutations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Cynatine HNS, a supplement containing keratin, vitamins, and minerals, improves hair and nail health compared to placebo.
results_summary: Subjects taking Cynatine HNS showed statistically significant improvements in hair loss, growth, strength, luster, and nail strength/appearance compared to placebo. The supplement was deemed effective within 90 days.
population_specificity: 50 females (25 in active group, 25 in placebo group).
effective_dosage: 2 capsules per day (each containing 500 mg Cynatine brand keratin plus vitamins and minerals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Cynatine(®) HNS, containing keratin, improves skin moisture, elasticity, wrinkle reduction, compactness, and appearance in females.
results_summary: Subjects taking Cynatine(®) HNS showed statistically significant improvements in skin moisture, elasticity, wrinkle reduction, compactness, and appearance compared to placebo after 90 days.
population_specificity: 50 females, randomized into active (n=25) and placebo (n=25) groups.
effective_dosage: 500 mg Cynatine(®) brand keratin plus vitamins and minerals, administered as two capsules per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review randomized studies on the efficacy and safety of oral ketamine for managing various types of pain.
results_summary: The study found mixed results, with some showing no difference between oral ketamine and other analgesics or placebo, while one study reported reduced local anesthetic use and intraoperative pain. Adverse reactions were common but severity was not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with refractory chronic neuropathic pain.
effective_dosage: 0.5 to 10 mg/kg, up to a maximum of 400 mg/day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether using ketamine for emergency rapid sequence induction (RSI) reduces the incidence of post-induction hypotension (PIH) compared to alternative induction agents.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in PIH incidence between ketamine and other induction agents, with a pooled odds ratio of 1.10 (95% CI 0.78-1.56). Subgroup analyses also showed no significant differences, though a trend toward higher PIH incidence was noted when comparing ketamine to etomidate.
population_specificity: Critically ill patients undergoing emergency RSI, including both medical and trauma cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of human serum as a single growth supplement (HSM) versus a complex medium (COM) for ex vivo expansion of human limbal epithelial cells (HLECs) on human amniotic membrane (HAM).
results_summary: Cultivation of HLECs in HSM produced a multilayered epithelium with cells expressing markers associated with limbal epithelial stem cells (LESCs) in basal layers. HSM showed higher p63α expression and more CK3-positive cells compared to COM, while CK12 expression was similar in both conditions.
population_specificity: Patients with limbal stem cell deficiency (LSCD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the diagnostic value of keratin 7 (KRT7) in distinguishing malignant metastasis of epithelial ovarian cancer from benign epithelial ovarian tumors.
results_summary: The study found that KRT7 expression was significantly higher in borderline tumors (53.5%) compared to benign tumors (28.4%) and normal tissues (12.1%), but lower in metastatic ovarian cancer (24.2%). KRT7 expression decreased with increasing tumor stage malignancy, showing significant differences between early and advanced stages.
population_specificity: Patients with benign epithelial ovarian tumors, borderline tumors, metastatic ovarian cancer, and normal ovarian tissues (n=120 total).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of periodic intravenous ketamine infusions for managing refractory chronic postsurgical pain (CPSP) in a patient unresponsive to conventional treatments.
results_summary: Ketamine infusions (30 mg every 30 days) provided substantial pain relief, improved mobility, and enhanced functionality in a patient with long-standing CPSP, aligning with existing evidence on ketamine's role in chronic pain modulation. The treatment showed minimal adverse effects at the administered dose.
population_specificity: A 63-year-old male with refractory CPSP for 5 years following inguinal hernia repair.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but periodic infusions were administered over an unspecified timeframe.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify sociodemographic and clinical features associated with non-response to ketamine in patients with treatment-resistant depression (TRD).
results_summary: The study found that 75% of patients were non-responders to ketamine, with non-responders showing lower rates of prior substance use disorder (SUD) and fewer psychiatric comorbidities compared to responders. These findings suggest that traditional TRD risk factors may not limit ketamine efficacy and could even enhance response.
population_specificity: 40 inpatients with treatment-resistant major depressive disorder.
effective_dosage: Intravenous dosage: 0.5 mg/kg; oral dosage: 2.0 or 2.5 mg/kg.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of nebulized ketamine in pain management through a systematic review of existing studies.
results_summary: Nebulized ketamine demonstrated rapid absorption, effective delivery, and fewer side effects, supporting its safety and efficacy for acute pain management, though further research on pharmacokinetics and dosing is needed.
population_specificity: Various contexts regarding pain management (specific populations not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of ketamine-assisted psychotherapy (KAP) in treating a patient with co-occurring borderline personality disorder (BPD) and depression.
results_summary: The case study reported positive outcomes, suggesting KAP may be beneficial for BPD and comorbid depression, warranting further systematic research.
population_specificity: A patient with co-occurring BPD and depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between problematic smartphone use, online gaming behaviors, and ADHD symptoms among individuals with ketamine use disorder.
results_summary: The study found that ketamine users at risk of problematic smartphone use had longer daily smartphone usage, higher ADHD symptom scores, and were more likely to use smartphones for online gaming.
population_specificity: 233 participants diagnosed with ketamine use disorder referred for court-ordered addiction treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop professional practice guidelines for the use of ketamine in psychiatric practice in Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand, based on scientific evidence and expert consensus.
results_summary: The guidelines provide consensus-based recommendations for ketamine use in clinical practice, balancing evidence-based practice with evolving research. They are intended to optimize patient outcomes and promote best practices among psychiatrists and clinicians.
population_specificity: Psychiatrists and clinicians engaged in ketamine therapy in Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the symptoms and causes of ketamine use disorder (KUD), evaluate the effectiveness of current treatment services, and identify strategies to improve patient access and outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that KUD is associated with high rates of physical (e.g., bladder and nasal problems) and psychological symptoms (e.g., cravings, low mood). Most individuals with KUD did not seek treatment, and existing services were often perceived as ineffective or poorly tailored.
population_specificity: 274 individuals with self-identified KUD, aged 18-67, including both treatment-seeking (40%) and non-treatment-seeking (60%) current or former ketamine users.
effective_dosage: Average daily consumption was 2.0 g, with treatment-seeking users reporting higher use (2.67 g) than non-treatment-seeking users (1.68 g).
study_duration: Survey conducted from November 2023 to April 2024 (6 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether baseline perceived stress levels influenced the response to ketamine or esketamine in patients with treatment-resistant depression (TRD).
results_summary: High baseline perceived stress was associated with lower odds of remission and required more ketamine treatments for remission, independent of baseline depression severity. Each 5-point increase in perceived stress reduced remission odds by 60%.
population_specificity: Adult patients with treatment-resistant depression (median age 47, 61.5% female).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of ketamine and esketamine in reducing depression and PTSD symptoms in veterans, while examining how comorbidities like TBI and OSA influence treatment outcomes.
results_summary: Ketamine and esketamine significantly reduced depression and PTSD symptoms in veterans, but no improvement was observed in those with comorbid TBI and severe OSA.
population_specificity: Veterans with treatment-resistant depression and PTSD, including subgroups with TBI and OSA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine ketamine's effects on reward responsiveness, particularly its antianhedonic action, under nonstressful and chronic stress conditions in rats.
results_summary: Ketamine increased reward responsiveness (prohedonic effects) in nonstressed rats, with effects dissipating within 24 hours. In chronically stressed rats, ketamine rescued blunted reward responsiveness (antianhedonic effects), persisting for nearly a week.
population_specificity: Rats (nonstressed and chronically stressed)
study_duration: Effects monitored up to 1 week post-administration

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of drug treatments, including melatonin combined with light therapy, on sleep disorders in people with dementia.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that one study combined melatonin with light therapy, but no specific results regarding light therapy's effects were reported.
population_specificity: People with dementia, primarily Alzheimer's disease, experiencing sleep disturbances.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the influence of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on postoperative pain after endodontic treatment, retreatment, and endodontic surgery.
results_summary: Most studies reported significantly less postoperative pain after LLLT, though two found no differences. The certainty of evidence was classified as low for treatment/retreatment and very low for endodontic surgery.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary root canal treatment, root canal retreatment, or periapical surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of bright light therapy among other interventions for treating sleep dysfunction in neurodegenerative diseases.
results_summary: The abstract highlights bright light therapy as an emerging intervention for sleep abnormalities in neurodegenerative conditions, suggesting it may be part of a broader therapeutic framework, though specific efficacy details are not provided.
population_specificity: Patients with neurodegenerative diseases experiencing sleep dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if photobiomodulation (PBM) could be an effective treatment for managing acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) in COVID-19 patients by modulating immune responses.
results_summary: The abstract suggests PBM has shown promising results in reducing acute pulmonary inflammation, but no specific outcomes or data are provided regarding its effectiveness in COVID-19-related ARDS.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients with ARDS (severe cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of conservative interventions, including morning bright light therapy, for improving sleep disturbances in adults with stroke or traumatic brain injury (TBI).
results_summary: Morning bright light therapy appeared more beneficial for fatigue rather than sleep disturbance after TBI, and the evidence for its efficacy in improving sleep was less clear. The study noted limitations such as heterogeneity and reporting of secondary outcomes.
population_specificity: Adults with a history of stroke or traumatic brain injury (TBI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of light therapy as a first-line treatment for seasonal affective disorder, including its effectiveness, safety, and recommended dosages.
results_summary: Light therapy was found to be typically effective at 2,500 to 10,000 lux for 30 to 60 minutes daily, with full remission of depressive symptoms when administered consistently. Evidence for long-term benefits is inconclusive, though continuing light therapy or antidepressants appears likely beneficial.
population_specificity: Individuals with seasonal affective disorder, particularly those with a family history, female sex, living at northern latitudes, or aged 18-30.
effective_dosage: 2,500 to 10,000 lux for 30 to 60 minutes daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different energy densities of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on pain reduction in patients with temporomandibular disorders (TMD).
results_summary: The study found that d1 laser therapy (energy density 0-10 J/cm²) was most effective for pain reduction in TMD patients immediately after treatment, while d2 laser therapy (energy density 10-64 J/cm²) showed better long-term effects. The analysis included 16 RCTs, suggesting varying efficacy based on energy density.
population_specificity: Patients with temporomandibular disorders (TMD).
effective_dosage: d1 laser therapy (0-10 J/cm²), d2 laser therapy (10-64 J/cm²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical and cost-effectiveness of topical corticosteroid monotherapy versus hand-held narrowband ultraviolet B (NB-UVB) light monotherapy and combination therapy for localized vitiligo.
results_summary: Combination therapy (NB-UVB light plus topical corticosteroid) was superior to corticosteroid monotherapy, with 27% of participants reporting significant improvement compared to 17% for monotherapy. The treatments were safe and well-tolerated, but efficacy was limited to about one-quarter of participants, and vitiligo tended to recur after treatment cessation.
population_specificity: Adults and children (aged ≥5 years) with active non-segmental vitiligo affecting ≤10% of their body area.
effective_dosage: Hand-held NB-UVB light therapy (approximately 20 minutes per session, 2-3 times per week) plus mometasone furoate 0.1% ointment.
study_duration: 9 months of treatment with a 12-month follow-up.
